1.content: Here are the main female characters of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney! You can choose one of them or go onto the next list of girls:
1.title: Ace Attorney Girls 1

choices: Maya just has some toast and eggs for breakfast
Screw waiting; Maya wants burgers NOW!
Maya just has some tea...but Phoenix seemed to have put something in it...
Maya suddenly loses control of her urges and devours Phoenix
A huge gut suddenly bursts out of Maya's robes and hangs over her waist
11.content:
The moment Maya Fey woke up, she had a sudden craving for her favorite food: hamburgers. However, it was early in the morning and, remembering what Phoenix had said about having to watch her weight, Maya knew there was no way she could satisfy her hungry desires now. Climbing out of bed, she got dressed and headed into the kitchen (?) of Wright & Co. Offices, where Phoenix was sitting at the table eating cereal and reading the paper.

Patting her belly and groaning in hunger, Maya failed to notice that she now had a slight buldge where a flat stomach once resided. 'Maybe I should lay off the burgers for a while...it's for my own good...' Maya thought as she gloomingly looked for something to eat.
11.title: Maya Fey

choices: Maya is more interested in the food.
111.content:
Maya went over to the stove and scrambled some eggs and but some toast in the toaster. This needs a little something…bacon! Bacon is great with eggs and toast. She rummaged through the fridge for bacon and sizzled some. We still have a box of pancake mix, which would be easy to fix. Then there’s milk and orange juice, and I could cook up some hash browns for Pearly. Nick’s eating cereal, which might be good too. Peanut butter and jam for the toast. Where’s the syrup?
A few minutes later Maya covered the table with a complete continental breakfast. “I’d thought I’d cook breakfast today, Nick. Where’s Pearly?”
“Oh…” Phoenix looked at the feast laid out before him. “That was a great idea, Maya, but Pearly was going back to Kurain this weekend for some training. I just wanted to eat quickly, because we have a new case today.”
“Really? What is it?” Maya sat down and ate the food hurriedly. Phoenix didn’t notice because he was looking over the case file he was starting.
“A woman was murdered in a supermarket yesterday. Our client was seen at the scene of the crime. After we meet him at the Detention Center we can check out the crime scene and interview any witnesses. I’ll just get some of your sister’s files that might help us here.”
When Phoenix left the kitchen Maya started eating faster. Better finish this before we leave, wouldn’t wan to spoil it. After the last pancake was eaten and the milk from her cereal drained, Maya sat back and sighed with pure pleasure.
Phoenix was surprised when he came back in and saw the empty plates. “Whoa, Maya, you keep eating that fast and you’ll outgrow your acolyte clothes.”
“Ha ha,” Maya cringed. Her stomach was getting bloated from the speed at which she had eaten breakfast. She secretly loosened her sash a bit as they left.

Their client at the Detention Center was a geeky looking man with ridiculous glasses named F. A. Feedem. Throughout the interview he kept nervously looking around, as if he thought people were watching him. “Did you kill the victim, Shelly Ulite?”
“No-o!” Feedem stammered. “I-I was just looking for her when I found here lying in that aisle.”
“Looking for her? Did you know the victim?”
“Y-yeah, just a little. I had seen her earlier in the supermarket when I was shopping and I tried to catch her attention, but I lost her for a while. The next time I found her she was…”
“Alright, Mr. Feedem, we’ll just investigate the crime scene now. If I may ask, what does F. A. stand for?”
“My name’s Fredrick Alfred Feedem, but I found F. A. to be a shorter and easier nickname.”

Ten minutes later Phoenix and Maya walked into the supermarket where the crime took place. With Phoenix’s attorney badge, they were able to get into an aisle that was roped off: the snack food aisle.
“Man, that’s a really big chalk line…” Maya said.
“Yeah. The victim was 21-year-old Shelly Ulite. She was rather overweight.”
“I wonder why she was killed.”
“That’s what we need to find out.”
111.title: New case: Turnabout Weight Gain

choices: Questioning was finished, so they could speak with the manager.
Questioning had not finished yet, so they had to investigate elsewhere.
Questioning had just finished, so they bumped into Gumshoe on his way out!
1111.content:
Something caught Phoenix's attention immediately when he began investigating. An unopened can of Coca-Cola standing upright only one inch away from the body outline.

"That's odd... What's this doing here?" Phoenix looked around, but there wasn't any soda anywhere in the isle.

"Nick, I thought you hated soda!" Maya had shouted in pure surprise.

"One, there's a difference between 'hate' and 'dislike'. Two, I'm looking at it because it's evidence. This can was just sitting upright next to the body, meaning that if it wasn't knocked over when the victim fell, it was placed here after the murder was committed."

Maya then spoke her own two cents, much to Phoenix's dismay, "One, if it was placed there after the murder, I don't see how it's important. Two, nobody cares about the difference between 'dislike' and 'hate'!"

"Well, if the can was placed here after the victim was killed, then the killer probably was probably trying to loot the corpse. Why else would they had left it behind, unless they needed a free hand?"

"But couldn't have one of the police officers have left it?" Maya suggested.

"The police may have made mistakes regarding who they've arrested in the past... But I'm pretty sure they know not to leave their drinks at a crime scene, Maya!" Phoenix was louder then he needed to be, but he can't help but get frustrated when Maya comes up with theories like that one.

"... Please stop yelling Nick..."

*Soda Can added to the Court Record*

"Hey, I think there's something over there at the end of the isle..." Phoenix started squinting his eyes, trying to tell if he isn't just seeing things that aren't there, but he went over to it once he was certain. It fit perfectly into his hand and was made of clear glass. "Why is this in a supermarket?"

"It's a 'SUPER' market Nick! Of course it has things you wouldn't find in a normal one!" Maya chimed in cheerfully.

("It looks Maya's brain still hasn't woken up yet today...") Phoenix couldn't help but sigh in his own mind. (It's absolutely stainless, not a drop of blood on it. Not to mention it's made of glass, so it would break incredibly easily. This means it couldn't be the murder weapon, but how does relate to the murder? I doubt it's here just by coincidence.")

*Glass Ball added to the Court Record*

"Well, it looks like there really isn't anything left that the police hadn't already taken back for forensics analysis, so perhaps we should go ask around?"

"What?! Look at all the food we haven't investigated yet!" Maya had a ravenous look on her face despite having eaten a massive breakfast not too long ago.

"... We're leaving Maya."

--- Checkout Lane #3 ---

"Looks like only one of the cashiers are here..."

"LISTEN, OKAY?! IF YOU'RE HERE TO PURCHASE, I'M KIND OF BUSY DOING EVERYTHING ELSE!!!" The man was absolutely furious, grinding his teeth to the point where enamel be seen being turned to dust.

"U-Um... We're not here to buy. I'm Mr. Feedum's lawyer, Phoenix Wright."

"Actually Nick, I wanted to-"

"No, Maya!" Phoenix turned his head at a speed that seriously is a contender for the world record.

"Well, if you're here to ask what I know, don't. I wasn't scheduled to work here yesterday, so I didn't come." The cashier was more depresses then angry now.

"You weren't here yesterday, yet you're here today?" Phoenix was rather curious as to why he was here. You'd assume a market would be closed if a murder investigation was underway.

"Because the manager hates me, that's why! She said I have to come in today and do all the work by myself since she didn't too many people around to distract the police from their job! Why not just wait until they're gone?!" Once again, the man began grinding his teeth to breaking point. "Now I have to count up yesterday's profits, mop up all the floors other than the crime scene, and sort every single item in the entire store!"

"Wow, you must be pretty good at your job if the manager has so much confidence in your ability to do all that by yourself in one day!" Phoenix had stated in order to try and calm him down.

"... Well... I guess that could be it." It seemed that Phoenix's idea had worked... For now at least. "My name is Pape Arplast; I'm twenty years old."

"Well Mr. Arplast, you said that you didn't have work during the day that the murder had occurred, but did you know the victim?" Phoenix hoped that perhaps knowing some background knowledge on the victim could establish a new lead.

"Know her? KNOW HER?!"

("... Dang it")

"EVERY SINGLE TIME SHE'S HERE, SHE COMES TO MY REGESTER!! NOT ONCE DOES SHE EVER GO TO A DIFFERENT ONE!! EVEN WHEN MY LINE IS CLUTTERED WITH A DIFFERENT LANE HAVING NOBODY THERE BUT THE CASHIER, SHE TAKES HER TIME IN LINE JUST TO MAKE MY DAY EVEN WORSE!! EVERY SINGLE TIME, SHE FLIRTS WITH ME AND IT GROSSES ME OUT TO THE POINT WHERE I SPENT A WHOLE HOUR IN THE SHOWER WHEN I GET HOME!!" Pape had become even more enraged then before... Which was quite a feat.

"... So I'm guessing you know her?" Phoenix could water a garden with the sweat he had produced during that sentence.

"Yes, I know her, but I wish that I didn't." It appeared that Pape had completely burned himself out.

"What are you thinking Nick?" Maya noticed just deep in thought Phoenix had just suddenly become.

"It appears that Pape has a motive... But he couldn't commit the murder if he wasn't here." Phoenix began thinking again. "... Pape, is the supermarket manager you mentioned here today?"

"Yeah, she was being questioned by that detective, but they might be done with that by now." Pape is still really winded after that burst of anger.

"Thank you for your time Pape. Time to head for the supermarket manager's office." Phoenix started walking towards the manager's office, with Maya following behind.
1111.title: They try to investigate.

choices: Go to the burger restaurant down the street.
Get groceries from the supermarket and prepare them back at the office.
11111.content:
--- Supermarket Manager's Office ---

"Well... This certainly wasn't what I was expecting it to look like..." Phoenix looked around, seeing more mystical items than just he had seen even during his visit to Kurain Village. "I... Didn't think a supermarket manager would so into the occult."

"Well it's nice to see some variety!" Maya was definitely happy to see that someone else in town was into the paranormal, though she certainly wasn't expecting it to be the manager of the local supermarket. "All you do is space out when I want to talk about it, Nick!"

"You talk about it sometimes? All I ever hear is 'BUUURGEEEERS! NICK I WANT BURGERS NOWWWW!'" Phoenix was simply joking, though Maya unfortunately didn't see through it.

"... Do I really sound like that?" Maya started to tear up just a little bit, but both her and Phoenix were then interrupted by a woman wearing the supermarket's employee uniform. She was 28 years old with long black hair, and pearl earrings.

"I foresaw your arrival. You are Nick 'Phoenix' Wright, and Maya Fey, yes?" Phoenix and Maya stood there shocked for a moment before she continued. "I am Fiora Tune, and I manage this store you are currently investigating."

"U-Um... I'd introduce myself, but you already know our names... somehow..." Phoenix didn't know how to respond to this woman. "S-So... Um... Ah! Could I... ask why you have all of these mystical items in your office?"

"... I have a gift Mr. Wright. I am able to foresee the future. I foresaw your arrival, I foresaw what would bring in new customers, and I foresee that you will finish questioning me and leave my office at exactly 1:28:56 PM. I believe that the spirits are leading me to a path of success with the ability they have gifted me."

"I see..." Phoenix wasn't any less confused, but at least he has a chance at learning new information from her. "Could you tell me when you first became aware of the murder that had occurred?"

"Yesterday at 3 PM, I was alerted by one of the employees, Ina Stockwell. She's a junior in high school who recently I recently hired as a grocery stocker."

"Let me guess, your gift foresaw her as an asset to the supermarket?" Phoenix still had a hard time believing that Ms. Tune had the ability to foresee the future.

"Yes, that is the case. Normally someone requires a high school diploma before they can get a job as a stocker, but I knew because of my gift that she was better then any high school graduate in this city." Ms. Tune didn't even look at Phoenix and Maya while she was talking.

("I think that might be illegal...") "So about when she had reported to you..." Phoenix was hoping to snap her back into reality.

"Ah yes. She had thought the victim was merely unconscious since the victim was collapsed on the ground with all the blood being covered by her head. After she lead me to the scene and I had realized what she did not, I told her to go call the police. That is basically all that had happened from my perspective. If you want all the details, you would have to talk with Ina. She should be in the storeroom." Fiora finally looked back towards Phoenix and Maya after she finished her explanation with a piercing glare.

"Um... Yeah, thank you." Phoenix felt like the temperature had suddenly dropped ten degrees when he locked eyes with Fiora's glare. "We talked with another employee before talking with you. Pape Arplast?"

"Pape is bar none my best employee. He is always on time, never makes mistakes, never has a single facial hair on his face, and never questions me no matter what request I may ask of him. I did not even need my gift to tell that he would be a fantastic addition. All I needed to do was look into his green eyes." Once again, Fiora turned her head and spaced out.

"You really appreciate Mr. Arplast that much?" Phoenix was certainly interested. He never heard a boss praise an employee this strongly before.

"Yes, he is the best employee I've ever had. Although he does anger issues, they should no longer be restrictive for him." Phoenix's attention was immediately caught by that one sentence.

"What do you mean by 'no longer'? Has he started taking anxiety medication?"

"No, it is because of murder. Pape had a seething hatred of the victim. I hate to say something so heartless, but I'm thankful that she is gone myself." Phoenix and Maya both reacted to Fiora's statement as anyone would after hearing someone say something along those lines.

What Fiora just said really struck a chord with Maya especially. "Hey! Why would anyone say that? Just because you'd admit that you'd hate to say that, doesn't make it any less horrible!"

"I understand, and apologize. However, if that woman had come to this supermarket any longer, I fear Pape would have finally snapped and quit. I would do anything to keep my best employee from leaving, so I'm glad things worked out the way that they did."

("Anything?") Phoenix couldn't help but consider Fiora Tune a suspect after hearing that bit. All Phoenix could do for now though is transition to a different topic. "Miss Tune, I was wondering... Did you actually ask Pape to do all of today's work all by himself?

"Yes, I personally asked him to come today and handle any work that had to be done today." It was subtle, but Fiora had proud tone in her voice.

"But... why? I don't think it would too much of an issue if there were more employees around during the investigation; in fact, it would tighten the credibility of any witnesses that are going to appear in court if their accounts match up. It just seems ridiculous to ask one employee to do the work of dozens." Phoenix couldn't help but find Fiora's reasoning strange... Even for someone who claims to be capable of predicting the future.

"I trust him above everyone else on staff. I asked him to do it by himself because I know he'd do it perfectly."

Phoenix still wasn't satisfied with Fiora's answer though. "So the reason you asked Pape to do it by himself was because he'd do it perfectly?"

"Yes Mr. Wright, that is my reason. Are you satisfied now?" Fiora began to do her intimidating glare once again, but that didn't stop the iron chains from appearing between her and Phoenix, followed by two red padlocks.

("Psyche-Locks...")

"Thank you for your time Fiora!" Despite Fiora's comment regarding the victim, Maya seemed to get over it rather quickly.

"It is fine, but before you go, could you tell me what time it is right now?" Fiora oddly doesn't seem to have a clock in her office...

"Hey Nick, let me see your watch!" Maya gripped Phoenix's arm and pulled it, causing Phoenix to suffer sudden pain in his shoulder.

"O-Ow! Dang it Maya! It's... 1:28 PM... Wh-What?! You don't even have a clock in here!" Phoenix was even more shocked then he was when Fiora's had guessed their names.

Fiora had formed a small smirk on her face. "I can foresee many things Mr. Wright, like I foresee the outcome at tomorrow's trial. I won't spoil the ending though, that would ruin the rest of it." Fiora then walked past them, out of the office.

"Well... that was weird." Phoenix just hoped this would be the weirdest it would be for a while, since he didn't think that he could take much more of it.

Hey Nick, I'm starving! Can we take a break from investigating and go get a bite to eat? The grocery stocker is probably still being interviewed anyways!" Maya as always was thinking about food, so Phoenix knew he had to get her something to eat if he didn't want her to keep bugging him about the entire rest of the investigation.

"Alright I guess. Where, pray tell, did you have in mind?" (Please don't be expensive... Please don't be expensive... Please don't be expensive...)
11111.title: Questioning was finished

choices: Cut to when Phoenix regains consciousness.
Switch to Maya's point of view for a while.
111111.content:
Maya already knew what she wanted. "Double Beef Burger is just down the street from here! I've been waiting all day for a hamburger and I'm not letting this chance pass by!"

Double Beef Burger isn't as expensive as you'd think it'd be for having "Double the Beef", but it isn't cheap either. But Phoenix also knew that "Double the Beef" also meant twice as filling, so maybe he wouldn't have to buy dinner for Maya later. "Alright, Double Beef Burger it is."

--- Double Beef Burger ---

"Burger time!!" Maya burst through the door of the fast food place, unable to wait to completely gorge on burgers.

Phoenix was reluctant to step inside, knowing that his poor wallet was about to receive a drastic liposuction, but he knew that the longer he waited in that doorway, the hungrier Maya would get. He walked towards the counter, fearing the worst from Maya's appetite. "Alright, what do you want Maya?"

"Well I-" Maya was about to list off two of everything on the menu, but she was interrupted by an employee on the other side of the counter.

"Hmm? Phoenix Wright? I wasn't expecting to see you here!" What immediately caught Phoenix and Maya's attention about the man at the counter in front of them was his hairnets. He had a big one that was used to cover the long brown hair that went down to his shoulders, but there was also one on his chin. The man had a beard that was also covered by a hairnet, this one having two straps that hung on his ears. He also had a deep voice that was so relaxed that it sounded like this man wouldn't even mind if the apocalypse happened. "Let me guess; you heard of our famous Mega Burger?"

"Umm... Do I know you?" Phoenix was confused by how the man was addressing him. He was talking as if the two of them knew each other, but Phoenix was certain he had never met this man before.

"No, but I know you, man! You're Phoenix Wright, the famous lawyer! Name's Sherman Allgood."

"Nice to meet you, but I don't really think I'm famous." Sherman certainly could have overheard some things from customers about Phoenix, but he really doubted he was such a hot topic at a fast food place to be interpreted as famous. "I've turned multiple cases around before, but that's only because the evidence led the way."

"Modesty. I respect that."

(Well, at least he seems like a nice guy.) "So Sherman, how did you learn about me? A lawyer isn't exactly someone you normally hear people talking about."

Sherman yawned, his mouth forming a bigger smile than before when it was done. "I'm a pretty social guy; I like talking to customers. Some of them happened to end up in the court audience during some of your cases. I've heard a lot of positive." Sherman is the type of guy who prefers listening to others' problems, so when he does talk, he gets straight to the point.

Phoenix knew that what Sherman was saying was possible, but it still wasn't coherent. "I'm glad to hear that, but I don't think that lawyers are something that people just talk about in a fast food place."

Once again, Sherman yawned before talking. "Conversations just flow from one topic to another sometimes."

Phoenix sighed. Sherman didn't detail his explanation as much as Phoenix would have preferred. (Unfortunately, I don't think this topic is going anywhere past this point.) "So have you heard about the murder that happened yesterday?"

"Yeah, I've heard; why are you asking? Did you take the case?"

Sherman didn't yawn this time, which told Phoenix that he might be able to get a conversation out of this topic. "Yes I did, but I'm taking a break from the investigation since one the key witnesses is being interviewed right now."

"I see. You know, the victim and defendant were both loyal customers here."

"Really? I wasn't expecting that."

Sherman chuckled a bit. "Yup. Shelly Ulite was quite big on the Mega Burger; that one is famous for a reason! As for Fredrick Feedums, he usually only orders a drink; he mostly just comes here to observe the lady customers."

Phoenix raised an eyebrow out of curiosity. "Observe?"

"Yeah, Fredrick is quite the fan of a lot of the female customers that come here. By the way, how did you learn of Fredrick's case? I've talked to him a few times, and he's told me that he prefers to avoid people unless he's coming here, so it doesn't seem likely you were asked by a friend of his."

While Phoenix was confused as to what Sherman meant by "fan", he decided it wasn't worth pursuing; besides, it would be rude to not answer Sherman's question. "I was woken up this morning by a phone call from Fredrick's mother, Clair Feedums. She was in a panic since she had just learned that her son was arrested on the charge of murder, so she wanted me to defend him."

"Ah, I see." Sherman chuckled again. Another employee then walked up to Sherman from behind, and whispered something into his ear. Sherman then turned to the other employee and grabbed something out of the other employee's hand. "Oh, here's your wallet back Mr. Wright."

"H-Huh?" Phoenix reached into his pocket; his wallet wasn't in there. "H-How did that guy get my wallet?!"

"That friend of yours gave it to him after she got her order to go. She left while we were talking." Sherman wore the same smile he had the whole time, not aware that what he said would horrify Phoenix even more.

Phoenix swiftly grabbed his wallet. "W-Why does it feel so much lighter?!"

"Let's see the receipt for the food your friend got... Twelve Mega Burgers, ten X-Large Fries, three orders of Onion Rings, and five X-Large Sodas, which adds up to a total of two hundred dollars... plus tax."

Phoenix's face drained of color. He turned around and dashed towards the door in order to go find Maya so he could chew her out. Phoenix was still running when the door swung open, smacking him hard in the head. Before he lost consciousness, Phoenix heard the person who accidentally hit him with the door.

"Oh drat! Sorry about that Pal!"
111111.title: Double Beef Burger

1111111.content:
"...H-Huh?" Phoenix woke with a jolt; he looked around and realized that he was still in Double Beef Burger, although he had been rested in one of the booths. Phoenix couldn't remember how he ended up falling unconscious; he didn't even remember anything after meeting Sherman Allgood.

"Hey Pal! You're awake!"

Phoenix turned his head and was met with a familiar scruffy detective. "Detective Gumshoe?"

"Glad to see I didn't hit hard enough to make you forget me!" The detective's expression changed to a frown as he scratched the back of his head. "Um... Sorry about that, by the way..."

Even though Phoenix's head was still in pain, he decided that it wasn't worth holding it against the detective. "It's fine, Detective. What are you even doing here?"

"Well, we finally finished all the witness interviews, so I thought I'd celebrate with a mega burger! I've heard those things are pretty good, and since this place is just down the street from the crime scene, I thought I'd give one a try!" Thanks to Phoenix's forgiveness, Gumshoe was able to cheer up quickly.

"Man, I told you things are famous!" Both Phoenix and Gumshoe looked over and saw Sherman Allgood at the counter with the same relaxed expression as before. "Glad to see you're alright by the way."

"Thanks Sherman." Phoenix turned back to Detective Gumshoe. (However, I should ask Detective Gumshoe a few questions about the investigation before I leave.) "So Detective Gumshoe, you said that the interviews with all the witnesses were finished, is that right?"

"That's right pal! We finished interviewing the stocker girl just before I came here."

"What about the investigation itself?"

"Hold it right there, Pal!" Gumshoe quickly tensed up, causing Phoenix to jump a bit. "I'm not helping you out this time!..." Like before, Gumshoe's expression changed to a more depressed one as he scratched the back of his head. "Well, um... I suppose I could at least give you something. Considering you've forgiven me for knocking you out earlier." Detective Gumshoe pulled a photograph out of a pocket on his trench coat.

Phoenix took a close look at the photo that Detective Gumshoe had given him. "A photo of the crime scene?"

"Yeah, for future reference." Gumshoe seemed to be really remorseful about his outburst.

*Crime Photo added to the Court Record*

"Sorry Pal. It's just that the prosecutor in charge of the case is making us all be even more careful when it comes to revealing information."

(The prosecutor in charge of the case?) "Hey Detective Gumshoe. Who exactly is in charge of the prosecution in this case?"

Gumshoe went into deep thought for a brief second. "...Well, I suppose telling you that isn't a big deal. The prosecutor you'll be facing tomorrow is-"
1111111.title: Cut to when Phoenix regains consciousness.

choices: Maya is found deep in a food coma after her huge fast food binge.
All of the take-out bags were empty, but Maya was nowhere here.
11111111.content:
"Edgeworth is prosecuting this case?" Phoenix was a bit surprised to hear that his friend would want to withhold information, even if they are rivals in the courtroom.

"Withholding information more so has to do with not leaking to the general public, rather than the defense." Detective Gumshoe then chuckled, "Turns out that some members of the force are worse at keeping secrets than me!"

"I can believe that..." Phoenix said, knowing that the police aren't exactly known for having a good track record.

Gumshoe took a few seconds to think before he spoke again, "Although, Mr. Edgeworth said it's important that the defense attorney for this case gets a photograph of the crime scene... Oh! Now that I think about, I didn't even ask if you had taken the case, I just assumed. Whenever I'm assigned a case, you're almost always the defense attorney!"

Phoenix thought about what Detective Gumshoe just said, (Now that I also think about it, Gumshoe is almost always the detective in the cases I end up taking. Weird coincidence.)

Phoenix pulled out the photograph of the crime scene that Detective Gumshoe gave him, "Detective, you said that this photograph would be for 'future reference'. What did you mean by that?"

"That photograph is the most important piece of evidence in this case. It's gonna be a big point of discussion in the trial tomorrow. Take a look at the victim." Gumshoe pointed at the body in the photo, "Notice how there's no blood."

Phoenix looked carefully around the corpse within the photograph, "... Not a single trace."

"Normally if a corpse isn't bleeding, that would suggest they died of strangulation or poisoning. But no, the victim died from loss of blood."

"What?" (The state of the crime scene contradicts the cause of death...), "So the body was moved?"

"That's the most likely explanation, but we've yet to make any headway." Gumshoe said glumly, "We've searched the entire supermarket, yet found not a single trace of blood."

"So the murder was committed somewhere else entirely? Then why move it to a busy supermarket full of potential witnesses?" Phoenix thought aloud.

"Not to mention all of the cashiers at the front, who the killer would have to pass by in order to reach the aisle where they left the body." Gumshoe sounded terribly pessimistic about finding possible breakthroughs. "Where the victim died could make or break this case, so take some time to think about possibilities, okay, Pal?"

"Thank you, Detective Gumshoe. I'll try to figure out where the true crime scene was." After thanking Gumshoe, Phoenix thought about the new information he was told, (This case is more confusing than first impressions led me to believe.)

"By the way, Pal..." Gumshoe interrupted, "Where's Maya?"

"Huh?" Phoenix's eyes darted around the room. He had completely forgotten about Maya; getting hit on the head does that to you, "I didn't realize she wasn't here."

"Was she with you when you came here?" Gumshoe asked.

"I'm pretty sure she was..." Phoenix rubbed his throbbing forehead, as if that would help him remember.

"Well, I'll let you know if I see her Pal. I've stayed here too long; I need to get back to the precinct. See ya Pal! Also, sorry again about your headache." Gumshoe then left after waving goodbye.

Phoenix tried to remember, but to no avail, (When did Maya leave?) He turned his head and saw Sherman Allgood still at the counter, relaxing since business was slowing down. Phoenix walked over to the counter to ask Sherman about Maya, "Hey Sherman, can I talk to you about something?"

"Hm?" Sherman turned his gaze towards Phoenix, "Yeah man; Ask away."

"Was there a girl with me when I originally walked in here? Wore weird violet and white clothing?"

"Yeah, why? Did that bump on your head mess up your memory?"

Phoenix became embarrassed, "This wouldn't the first time it happened..." Ironically, this brought back bad memories.

Sherman laughed, "Don't worry about it man. But yeah, your friend was here; she left just before that detective came in."

"Did she by any chance mention where she was going?" Although it didn't seem likely that Maya would mention that to a cashier, it wouldn't hurt to ask.

Sherman scratched his head, "No, but from what I know about fast food, people typically head back to their place when they get takeout."

Phoenix cocked his head, confused, "Wait, she got take out? But I was the only one with money out of the two of us..." Phoenix then came to a disheartening realization. He quickly pulled out his wallet, and looked inside to see two-hundred dollars missing, "Did she really just spent two-hundred dollars on fast food?!"

"Plus tax." Sherman couldn't help but chuckle.

Phoenix's face drained of color, and he dashed for the exit.

Sherman quickly responded, "Slow down! Someone might-"

Phoenix's face was suddenly met with pain for a second time as the door opened. "Sorry for interrupting, Pal! I forgot my-... DARN IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT!!!"


***Wright & Co. Law Offices***



Phoenix walked in while holding an ice pack to his head. After the trauma he already went through today, he was not happy to continue with the investigation. At least this trip back to get Maya would give him a short break.
11111111.title: Why do I like hurting Phoenix?

choices: Maya arrived! She digested all the fast food, and developed rolls of fat.
Ina was 400 lbs.! How did she sneak up on him at that size?
111111111.content:
Phoenix opened the door to his office and looked around, trying to find Maya. At first he didn't see her, but he did see take-out bags scattered on the food, all empty. Phoenix sighed, "She steals my money, and then she leaves me to clean up what she bought with it." As Phoenix walked over to clean up the mess that Maya had left behind, he discovered that she was sound asleep on the couch, just hidden by its back. He then saw where all the missing food ended up.

Phoenix held his free hand over his face as he groaned because he didn't want to look. He already knew that Maya is a glutton, but this was too much. Maya had eaten herself into a food coma. Maya's gut was a large mound of flesh, still taut due to digesting such an absurd amount of fast-food being a heavy burden for her body. Her robes just barely managed to constrain it from bursting out onto display, but it was still blatantly noticeable. In contrast, the rest of her body barely plumped up at all yet due to the previously mentioned issue with digestion.

It didn't help that Phoenix was already in a bad mood, but he couldn't afford to wait for Maya to wake up. There were still several things left to investigate before the day ended, and time seemed to be moving faster than it usually does. He quickly jotted down a note explaining that he came back to the office, but left again, using the excuse that he should try to meet with the stocker girl before she leaves the supermarket to go home. Phoenix continued to hold the ice pack to his head as he left, as the pain had just gotten worse.



***Future Mart: Checkout Lane #3***



Since Phoenix had failed to realize that he didn't know where the stocker girl was, or even what she looked like, his best option was to ask one of the other employees he met. Although this was where they met earlier, Phoenix didn't see Pape anywhere, meaning he probably finished counting up the supermarket's profits from yesterday, and went to work on another job he was given by Fiora. Phoenix glanced over at the door to the Fiora's office, which was currently locked tight like the pair of psyche-locks around her heart, (I actually forgot about Ms. Tune's secret. Hopefully I'll have time to look into it.)

Unfortunately, this left Phoenix with no lead to follow, so he resorted to wandering around the supermarket in hopes of finding the stocker by himself.



***Future Mart: Baked Goods Center***



After practically searching the entire supermarket, Phoenix ended up in the Baked Goods Center in the back, next to the aisle where the body was found. This was the only place Phoenix hadn't searched yet, so if the stocker girl was still in the supermarket, she would have to be here. Phoenix scanned the area, seeing all the variety of different pastries in display cases. There was also plenty of ingredients for baking on the shelves near the crime scene, although Phoenix noticed a gap between items while looking, (Hm?) Upon closer inspection, Phoenix saw there was baking soda farther back on that part of the shelf, but one box was missing, causing the gap that caught his attention, (That's odd...)

A teenage girl casually approached Phoenix from behind while he was focusing on the baking soda. She had straight medium-length hair that was brown like her eyes, and was clad in the supermarket employee uniform. She crossed her arms in aggravation before speaking in a bored tone, "Sir?"

"Ah!" Phoenix was surprised the girl's sudden appearance, "W-Where did you come from? This place was empty a moment ago!"

"Not important, now might I ask what you're doing here?"

Phoenix, still recovering from the shock, replied immediately, "Um, I'm investigating the murder that occurred here yesterday..."

The girl loudly groaned, "Oh great, that means I have to repeat what I saw agaaaaain..."

"Huh?" Phoenix then came to a conclusion that was obvious in hindsight, "So you're the stocker who saw the defendant flee the crime scene? Ina Stockwell, right?"

Ina sighed, and then answered Phoenix, "Yeah, whatever, can we make this quick, I'd like to finish some time today." She then tilted her head to rest it on her fist.

Phoenix didn't want to waste Ina's time, but he had a hard time focusing because something caught his attention...
111111111.title: Maya's Dough is Rising

1111111112.content: I meant for this branch to have Ina be 300 lbs. because that seemed far more reasonable, but I misclicked. But why rain on someone else's parade and change it with this chapter? So I'm going to let people choose whichever option they want.
1111111112.title: Pay attention when typing, kids

1112.content:
“Hey Nick, check this out.”

“What, Maya?”

“No one else can get to this aisle, so we could practically eat this stuff for free.”

“What kind of a thought is that? You can’t go around eating food from a supermarket.” But Maya wasn’t paying attention. She had already opened a box of toaster pastries and was cramming them into her mouth.

“Hey pa!! Wadda ya think you’re doing?” Detective Gumshoe came running over to them.

“Eeekk!” Maya was so scared she swallowed the rest of the tarts and almost choked.

“You can’t go eating stuff in a supermarket without paying for it!”

“See Maya, even Detective Gumshoe knows not to do that.”

“You can’t especially eat stuff here. This is the crime scene, for Pete’s sake! You could be contaminating the evidence.”

“Sorry,” Maya said. “I just thought it would be cool to grab something while the supermarket was closed.”

Gumshoe chuckled. “It’s true the rest of the supermarket is closed. We just felt that this was the only aisle that needed to be investigated. So you can’t eat anything in this aisle.”

“Nothing in this aisle? Then…Whoo-hoo! We have ourselves a loophole. Come on Nick, free food!” She ran off.

Phoenix winced to the sound of Maya tearing open boxes of cookies in the next aisle. “Nice going, Gumshoe. I think you just let the kid loose in the candy store…and by ‘kid’ I mean ‘bull’ and by ‘candy store’ I mean ‘china shop.’”

Gumshoe looked downcast. “Yeah, I know…”

“So what evidence have you gathered so far? Do you know how the victim was killed?”

“Nope. The body didn’t have any bruises or wounds on it, so it wasn’t by physical means. We won’t know for sure until an autopsy is done.”

“Isn’t there any footage on the store cameras?”

“Supermarket’s been having electrical troubles since yesterday. The cameras weren’t working yesterday.”

“Any witness? I mean, why kill someone in a super market? There are dozens of potential witnesses to see you do the horrendous deed.”

“The crime was committed in the slowest part of the day. There were only a few people here, including staff, the victim, and two witnesses who might have seen something. We got the defendant picked up ‘cause he was acting all suspicious. On a hunch, we took his fingerprints and found they matched prints found on the floor right next to the body.”

That’s not really enough to make a cause against Feedem yet, Phoenix thought. And there’s a good chance the victim wasn’t killed in a struggle. I have to find out more information.

“Who are the witnesses?” Phoenix asked.

“There are only a few of them. They were working in the area around the supermarket since before the crime occurred. Street vendors, I think. We’ve already talked with them, but they didn’t see anything too important.”

“I guess I should talk with them. Now I just have to deal with Miss Competitive Eater over here…”

Phoenix found Maya in the next aisle over. She had made quite a dent in the cookie shelf. She was stuffing brownies down her throat. Crumbs covered her robe, which looked a little tighter.

“Geez, Maya, what’s your problem today?”

“I’m just hungry, Nick. I missed dinner last night because I was up working with you.”

How is that my fault? She misses one square meal a day and suddenly she eats like she survived through a famine! I guess it’s from all those times she’s been kidnapped and almost starved to death. “Let’s just get out of here and talk to witnesses before you get us in trouble.”
1112.title: Off Limits.

choices: Maya eats five of the lunches and becomes stuffed.
11121.content:
Phoenix and Maya went to a park by the supermarket.

“So who’s this witness, Nick?”

“Street vendor, according to Gumshoe. He said he got a box lunch off of her.” Box lunch, Phoenix thought suddenly. Could it be?

“I knew you would always come back for my squid wheels.”

Phoenix flinched when a pink lunchbox was thrust into his face. “Angel Starr! You’ve been selling lunches here?”

“Of course, sugar. Where else would I sell lunches?”

“Who is she, Nick?” Maya asked.

“Oh that’s right, Maya. Miss Star was a witness in a case I had when you went back to your hometown to pick up your duties. Did you witness the murder that took place in the supermarket yesterday?”

“Yes. I was just getting some fresh ingredients and dropped off a lunch for one of my boyfriends.”

One of my boyfriends? Phoenix thought.

“So let’s cut to the chase already,” Maya said.

“Yeah,” Phoenix started. “Did you—”

“What kind of lunches do you have?” Maya licked her lips. Phoenix almost fell over.

“My specialties today are a stir fry box or a marinated beef sandwich.”

“Man, they both sound good. But which to have?”

“I can tell you’re the hungry type,” Miss Star smiled. “If you’re interested, I have my special ‘Ten Lunchbox Hungry Man’ set. Ten lunches and appetizers put together at an affordable price. Ten pounds of my most fattening food to fill up those hungry tummies.”

“Sounds great!” Maya said. “Wanna split, Nick?”

“No, I’m not hungry. Um…how much do I owe you, Miss Star?”

“Oh don’t worry about that, we’re old friends! However, I just might ask for a favor in the future. You’ll help me, right?”

Phoenix gulped. “Could I ask you a few questions, Miss Star?”

Maya went over to a park bench and opened the tower of lunchbox’s she had gotten. The lunches were stuffed with some of her favorites like macaroni and cheese, fish ‘n’ chips, pizza and chicken nuggets. While Phoenix interviewed Angel Star, Maya ate with abandon. Just why was Maya so hungry?
11121.title: Angel Star

choices: Maya drags Nick off to the ice cream shop on Main Street.
Nick protests, and wonders if something funny's going on.
111211.content:
Nick sighed heavily as he lumbered over the park bench, where Maya - in no short order - finished the last of the lunches. Good night, the girl could eat!

"That was sooo good. But ooh, maybe I over did it," Maya said, rubbing her stomach.

Nick's eyebrow rose. "Ya think?" He swore she'd gained nearly ten pounds since they left the agency. He poked her protruding stomach, amazed at how it began spilling over her waistband, but she playfully swatted his hand away.

"What's got into you, anyway?"

Maya grinned. "I don't know, but I think I like it. It feels good, and I feel good. In fact--" she waggled her eyebrows at him - "I'd love some dessert right now. Maybe a sundae. Ooh, or a giant Brownie Explosion on that ice cream shop on Main Street. Covered in fudge and ice cream, and--"

Her stomach rumbled, and Nick stared at her in awe. "I can't believe you're still hungry. You eat much more of that junk, and you're gonna balloon up like there's no tomorrow."

"C'mon, Nick," she said, grabbing his hand. Her eyes glazed over and he swore she licked her lips. "I can't interview anyone on an empty stomach."
111211.title: Maya eats five of the lunches and becomes stuffed.

choices: Maya eats every hot dog in the cart!
11122.content:
Phoenix and Maya walked down the street. Phoenix looked over his notes. “One of the witnesses was a hot dog vendor that was working on a corner a few blocks away from the supermarket.”

“Mmm, hot dogs. Can we get some hot dogs, Nick?”

“Hot dogs! You want hot dogs after the carnage you left back there! It will take a sheer amount of dumb luck for me to buy you hotdogs today!” And with that, Phoenix collided with an inflatable Steel Samurai.

“Hey Nick, it’s a Samurai Dog cart! And look at who’s selling them…”

“Larry!” Phoenix gasped. “You’re selling hot dogs again?”

“Shut up Nick!” Larry Butz frowned at him. “I told you my name was Laurice Deauxnim!”

“So wait, you sell hot dogs and you paint?”

“Well, painting pictures and selling hot dogs have been the only things I’m good at, and they aren’t to rewarding alone, so I’ve been doing them together. Although I haven’t been able to sell any with all the police presence here.”

“So you know about the crime, then? Did you see anything at the supermarket?”

“No. I just went there to get some more ketchup and mustard. I didn’t see anything on my way out, but as I was walking away this really geeky looking guy ran past me in a panic. Say Nick, want a picture? I could paint you a portrait as you pose with a half eaten Samurai Dog, wiping mustard off your face.”

“No thanks, Larry.”

“Ah come on, Nick,” Maya said. “Give the guy a break. He hasn’t been able to sell these juicy hotdogs all day. Could I have a Samurai Dog, Larry?”

“Sure, Maya, have as many as you want. I couldn’t even sell these now even if everyone was as rich as Edgeworth.”

Sheer dumb luck, Phoenix thought. Me and my big mouth.

Maya pulled out two hot dogs from Larry’s cart and added mustard and ketchup to them. She half listened to Phoenix and Larry as they talked about the case and chewed the fat, but she was more focused on eating…
11122.title: Larry Butz

choices: What happens to Maya? Read on!
111222.content:
Maya gave in to her ravenous appetite. As Phoenix tried to get a strait answer out of Larry, the spirit medium continued to eat hotdog after hotdog. She was skilled at adding toppings so that each frankfurter was a different experience. Ketchup with mustard. Mustard only. Ketchup with cheese sauce. Chili and sauerkraut. Sauerkraut with onions and pickle relish. And one brave attempt of every topping at once. Oblivious to the amount of sausages she was consuming, Maya ate her way through every possible topping combination she could think of…

When Larry and Phoenix looked back in Maya’s direction minutes later, they were in for quite the shock. The surface of Larry’s cart was a Jackson Pollock of spilled condiments. No bun or wiener had survived Maya’s onslaught. The gluttonous girl herself had her cheeks and hands painted with every possible edible hue. There were also stains on her noticeably looser sash. Her middle looked thicker too.

Larry surveyed the bratwurst carnage. “Hot dang, Maya! How did you manage to do that?”

Maya stifled a grunt. “Nick’s been starving me.”

Larry’s mood swing was faster than his change of occupation. “What are you doing, Nick, letting a pretty girl starve like that?!”

“Huh?” Phoenix looked dumbfounded in Maya’s direction. “Liar! I happen to know you’re the biggest eater in Wright & Co. Law Offices! How did you manage to eat every single corndog?”

“Hotdogs, Nick. Seriously.” Maya rolled her eyes. “I was just trying some variation. The next time you eat hotdogs you should try pink and blue sauce instead of just having it plain.”

“Blue sauce?” Larry repeated. He walked over to the back of the cart in order to open the bottom drawer. “Ahhhhhh! My paint! Those weren’t condiments, Maya, that was PAINT!”

“WHAT?!” Maya’s large mouth dropped open, revealing the disgusting, partially digested remnants of her hot dog dinner. She clutched her enlarged stomach. “My tummy doesn’t feel all that well…”

Whether it be from indigestion or food poisoning, Phoenix said in his head.

Larry gestured back with a hand. “Public restrooms are a block that way, Maya.”

“Thanks.” She scuttled off.

Phoenix sighed, his palm pressed against his forehead. “I swear, I can’t take her anywhere…”

Maya emerged from the toilet, glad that that was out of her system. She washed her hands in the sink. When she looked up, a dark figure had moved up behind her. She had just enough time to scream before she blacked out.
111222.title: Combonations!

choices: Follow Maya as she is force-fed.
Follow Phoenix as he searches for Maya.
1112221.content:
Maya groaned. She awoke to find herself secured to a table. The room was dark, but she sensed that she wasn’t alone.

“H-Hello?”

“You’re lawyers looking into Shelly’s death, correct?” The harsh voice was unrecognizable to Maya.

“Huh? Y-yes, we are…”

“You’re sticking your nose where it doesn’t belong,” the menacing voice replied.

“Did you kill Shelly Ulite?” Maya gasped.

A vindictive chuckle rang out from the darkness. “Is that what you think? Even if I did, there’s no way you or your attorney friend can prove it.”

Maya struggled to move her head in the direction the voice was coming from. “Then what are you going to do to me?”

There was a pause. “I’ve been watching you from the moment you started your investigation. I must admit that I am…pleased by your unique talents.”

“Talents?”

“Yes, talents Shelly had too before she turned against me. You are budding rather well and your actions at the hotdog stand were most amusing. I wish to help you with your progress.

Suddenly a hand appeared from behind Maya’s head. A strange, vicious substance was forced into her mouth. It tasted like cinnamon and also cookie dough. She gagged it down. “What was that?”

“Just something to start you along your way. Is it tasty? I hope it is. Shelly liked it too, but she got away from me. I’ve learned from my past mistakes, so you should plump up rather well.”

Maya opened her mouth to scream but she was silenced by a burning sensation in her swollen stomach. An electric charge flowed through her as her appetite was revitalized. She felt like she could eat anything.

The dark figure in the shadows grinned wickedly. “Are you hungry yet?”
1112221.title: Captured!

choices: The mixture runs out, but the stranger has more plans
Someone runs in to the rescue!
11122211.content:
Hungry? Maya felt as she had been starved for weeks on end, the poor hot dogs from Larry's stand completely erased from her mind, if not her bulging midsection. She couldn't help but nod in response to the dark figure's question, almost salivating from her sudden desperate need for food. It wasn't every time she got kidnapped that she got fed, she wanted to make the most out of a bad situation. The figure chuckled, the same thin fingers sliding over her cheek to slip a tube between her awaiting lips, a strap fixed gently, but firmly, about her face to keep it in position. Too hungry to care about the dire situation she was in, the fact this stranger was going to do something to her that had killed another young woman, or even about Nick, Maya eagerly awaited for what would come out of the promising tube. The stranger clearly picked up on her eagerness, a dark chuckle leaving him as a low whirring filled the silence of the room, a thick and creamy mixture being pumped along the see-through tubing to the awaiting spirit medium's mouth.

It tasted like nothing she had ever tasted before in her life, sweet and refreshing, with a tang to keep it from being sickly. It was thick, filling, and any resistance the dark haired girl had, vanished all together the moment it settled into her stomach. Maya moaned about the tubing, the mixture tasted so good, and felt even better in her previously painfully swollen stomach, this just seemed to ease into the space, swelling gently in comparison. The fattening mixture increased, Maya's stomach starting to bloat further, the already strained material of her acolyte robes pulling tighter, her sash working loose as it was unable to contain the rising mound of flesh. The robes started to part without the sash in place, a peak of her pale flesh showing against the darker material as it fell from the increasingly chubby belly. Maya seemed oblivious, her only thought on the mixture working its way down her throat, and whether there was more to come, even as her belly grew enough to block her feet from her view.
11122211.title: Follow Maya as she is force-fed.

choices: Gumshoe comes and tells them about a new break in the case.
Phoenix tries to figure out why Maya is so hungry.
11123.content:
The police vans were set up in the parking lot behind the supermarket. It was the headquarters for the investigation. Maya thought she saw Edgeworth talking to some of the head investigators, but she couldn’t be sure. “Who’s the witness, Nick?”

“I’m not sure. They were keeping him here until they finished questioning him, but Gumshoe didn’t know his name.”

Someone almost walked into them. “Oh, pardon me sir.”

Phoenix did a double-take. “Aren’t you that bellboy from the Gatewater Hotel? What are you doing here?”

The bellboy was holding his tray, as usual. “Unfortunately the police are keeping me here until they finish their investigation. But of course, I never mind helping the police.”

“That tray looks rather heavy. Doesn’t it ever tire you?”

“Not at all, sir. I’ve taken training to handle it.”

“What were you doing all the way out here, then?” Maya asked.

“I needed to pick up an item for a guest’s meal.” The bellboy lifted the lid of his tray. “16oz filet mignon with extra creamy mashed potatoes, rotisserie chicken in a lemon glaze with rice pilaf, and breaded sea bass on a bed of asparagus with lemon garnish. Unfortunately, the hotel ran out of water chestnuts, so I had to come here to buy some. Since I’ve been here since last night, helping the police, I’m afraid it’s gotten far too cold.”

Wouldn’t bringing it all the way to a supermarket in this weather make it cold? Phoenix thought. “That’s quite the dinner. Was it all for one man?”

“Yes, sir. I believe it was a guest speaker at a conference the hotel was hosting. A big man with a large mustache, named Mr. Grossberg, I think.”

Poor Grossberg, Phoenix thought. He missed his chance for the scent of fresh lemons…

“To bad about that,” Maya said. “Doesn’t anyone want to have it?”

“I’ve offered to the detectives, but they’ve been far to busy to eat a nice dinner.”

“I’ll eat it!” Maya licked her lips.

“Very good, miss. Might I interest you in some fresh ground pepper?”

Don’t tell me he has ground pepper with him, Phoenix thought. Maya accepted the dinner and the pepper, and then ate through it as Phoenix interviewed the bellboy. He had seen the victim right before she was murdered, it seems, and that’s why the police were keeping him here until they could collaborate his testimony. When he finished, Phoenix saw that Maya had eaten the whole dinner and was wiping her mouth with a napkin. Her stomached seemed a little bigger, but Phoenix couldn’t be sure.

Dear Lord, what has gotten into Maya lately? How could she be this hungry?
11123.title: The Bellboy

111231.content:
It turned out that the victim had died from a heart attack. Nobody was murdered after all! :D

The End































(I'm so sorry.)
111231.title: Oopsy-Doodle!

111232.content:
Phoenix pretended to go to the bathroom but snuck back to the crime scene. He found the spot where Maya had eaten the toaster pastries earlier. He grabbed a box next to the one Maya had eaten and snuck it into his jacket. Then he went of to find Detective Gumshoe.

“Hey Gumshoe; I want you to take a look at this.”

Gumshoe took the box of toaster pastries. He laughed. “I know you’re just trying to be nice, but I don’t need your pity. I usually have instant oatmeal for breakfast.”

“No, this isn’t a charity gift. It’s one of the items from the scene of the crime. Call it hunch, but I’m willing to bet that if these get analyzed the crime lab would find something different with them.”

Gumshoe inspected the box more closely. “They look a lot like ones we found in the victim’s cart. Just about every item in the cart was already opened. We thought the killer was rummaging through her purchases for something. I’ll try to get it in.”

“That’s great. Try to get it analyzed before court tomorrow.”

When he came back to where Maya was sitting he saw that she was half-way through a tall stacked ice cream cone. “Where did you get ice cream?”

“I hailed down an ice cream truck, silly.” Maya licked melted vanilla from her lips. “I tried to get him to wait for you but you weren’t coming out here fast enough.”

“Well, come on. We have some more leads to investigate.”

They spent the rest of the day checking witnesses and checking the alibis of everyone. When they made it back to the office Phoenix sat down and cataloged his notes, trying to make sense of the Court Record. Since Phoenix didn’t ask for her help, Maya sat down on the couch and consumed several bags of chips while watching Steel Samurai reruns. At ten o’clock they both went to bed.

After midnight, Maya woke up to her stomach gurgling. Getting up carefully, she snuck to the kitchen and rummaged for goodies. She stuffed herself with an old box of doughnuts and raided half the fridge before she felt satisfied. She snuck back off to bed.

When she awoke, Maya noticed that her stomach was flabbier, as her binges yesterday began to add pounds to her figure. She tied her acolyte sash as loose as she could make it, and still it was stretched tight over a forming potbelly. She didn’t think of it, as her thoughts turned to the trial today.

Phoenix was already getting ready when she went to the office. “We still don’t know a lot about this case. I think I can manage the trial today, but I want you to get more information.” He handed her one of his old briefcases. “Try to find out as much as you can about the victim, Shelly Ulite, and her possible relation to Mr. Feedem. I’ll call you during recess.”

“Alright, Chief!” Maya saluted.


Detective Gumshoe approached Phoenix as the defense attorney entered the courtroom. “You were right about those toaster tarts, pal. We found this mysterious chemical in the box you had us analyze, and get this: we also found it in the victim’s body and in her box of tarts!”

“Really? What chemical was it?”

“I can never pronounce chemical names, pal. Crime lab discovered it’s similar to a new appetite stimulator that negates the pain of overeating. Supposed to help people with rare disorders or something. I’ll talk about it all when I officially announce the results of the autopsy. The plot thickens!"

“I’m sure Maya ate those kinds of toaster pastries yesterday. But why would that chemical be there.” His eyes grew worried as he realized something.

“What’s wrong, pal? Bailiff just called court to begin.

Phoenix would have no way of contacting Maya for the next few hours. “Maya could still be under the effects of the chemical. And she has the suitcase with my wallet in it!”


Maya looked through the information as she waited for a bus. Silly Nick, he’s left his wallet in here. I wonder if that means he’s treating me to lunch. Her stomach grumbled again. My bus is coming. Should I investigate first, or eat first?
111232.title: The plot thickens.

choices: Cora takes Maya to the 'Conference Room'
1112321.content:
Although Maya was feeling really hungry, she new that Phoenix would be busy in court and he would need whatever information she was able to find at a moment’s notice. She boarded her bus and headed to the part of town where the address was.

Maya looked at the letters on the door to the building. HIPPO MAGAZINE. What a funny name for a business. Inside was a lobby with extra wide chairs and numerous different soda and snack machines. Maya walked up to where a girl was sitting behind a desk.

“Excuse me, my name’s Maya and I’m part of a law firm that’s investigating the death of Shelly Ulite.”

“Oh, you mean Shell? It was such a horrible thing that happened to her, wasn’t it?” The woman stood up. She was probably in her mid twenties but was one of the fattest women Maya had ever seen. Her large gut and extra wide hips, where most of her flab sat, were draped in a blouse that was cut short ‘in all the right places.’ “I’m Cora Pulent.” She offered a hand.

“What exactly was Shelly’s job?”

“Oh, she was one of our best models.”

“She was a model?” Maya said in surprise.

“Of course. Here at HIPPO Magazine, we’re all about embracing the heavier side of femininity. I must say, Maya, your costume shows off your ‘budding’ rather well.”

“What? These are just my acolyte’s clothes,” said Maya, oblivious to her chubby midsection. She pulled out a case file. “Do you think Shelly might have dated this guy?” She showed Cora F. A. Feedem’s picture.

Cora smiled. “Oh, I’ve seen him around. Poor guy was chasing after Shelly but never managed to catch her. I know they were childhood sweethearts once.”

Without warning Maya’s stomach let out a humongous growl. She clutched her stomach, embarrassed. She hadn’t had anything to eat today, and her body was craving food because of the chemical she had ingested the other day.

Cora giggled. “Sounds like somebody wants something to eat. Care to have lunch while we talk about the case?”

Maya nodded. Nick can’t harbor me for eating and working at the same time, she thought.
1112321.title: HIPPO Magazine

choices: Lotta and Maya eat more food
11123211.content:
“We’ll just eat in the Conference Room.” Cora led Maya down a hallway to a pair of double doors.”

“Don’t you have a cafeteria or something?”

“Oh yes, but the Conference Room is much more fun.” Cora opened the doors and Maya gasped in amazement. Instead of being used for meetings, the long table was used for a buffet. Almost every food imaginable was there, laid out for the magazine’s models and employees to eat. Maya sniffed and the juicy sent of her favorite food, burgers, met her noise. Saliva formed in her mouth.

Cora smiled. “Oh please, pull up a chair and help yourself.”

Maya needed no second bidding. She leaped into a chair by a tray of burgers and grabbed a triple patty with four slices of cheese and the works. Maya ate in five big bites and grabbed another burger. Even before she had swallowed her second one, Maya grabbed a third and began eating it. Cora, helping herself to a steak, laughed.

Her craving for burgers settled for now, Maya went to investigate the other trays of food on the conference table. She helped herself to some macaroni and cheese, some greasy french fries, some more burgers, several slices of pizza, and washed it down with a big milkshake from a dispenser on one side of the room. For dessert she had a plate of cookies, a few cupcakes, and several slices of apple pie and cheesecake.

Finally Maya stretched back for a breather, the sash of her acolyte clothes noticeably tighter.

Cora giggled. “Oh my, Maya, you have quite the appetite.”

“It’s funny, but I’ve just been so hungry lately.”

“Maya! Well shoot, as I live and breathe, girl, what a crazy spot to run into you!”

“Lotta!” Maya gasped, for several different reasons. It was Lotta Hart, the photographer with the big hair and the big mouth, but other parts of her were now big as well. Lotta had blossomed into a 200+ beauty since the last time Maya had seen her. Lotta’s green pullover struggled to contain a massive belly equal in size to Cora’s. “What are you doing here?”

“I’ve just been going wherever the wind takes me, girl. I actually came here for a part time assignment and I’ve stayed.”

“We’ve managed to get her on the other side of the camera too.” Cora gave Lotta’s stomach a slap. “Isn’t that right, ‘Lotta Belly’? The girl with the stomach as big as her hair!”

“Oh, stop it!” Lotta grinned in embarrassment. “Ya’ll got any more fried chicken in here?”
11123211.title: A familar face

Although her stomach was starting to get stuffed, Maya reached over to grab a quadruple cheeseburger with bacon and started eating it.

“Oh Maya,” Cora said, getting up to stack empty plates. “You have a rather impressive skill set. You sure you wouldn’t want to switch jobs and work for us?”

“If Nick doesn’t take me out for burgers anymore when we win a case, I might consider it.”

Cora laughed and exited the room. Lotta leaned over from her plate of fried chicken. “I want to show ya something Maya, but it’s really top secret, ok?”

“What is it?”

Lotta checked to make sure no one else was in the room, and then went over to a cupboard and opened the door carefully. She took a spoon and scooped up something from a basin. “I’m not even supposed to be showing this to someone who isn’t an official employee, but I reckon you’re a friend, so it’ll be ok.”

Maya took the spoon from Lotta. In the spoon was something that looked like tan whipped cream. “It smells like cookie dough.”

“Go on, have some.”

The thick cream instantly melted in her mouth, and Maya savored the sweet taste. “That stuff tastes fantastic! What is it?”

Lotta whispered, even though there was no one else in the room. “It’s the magazine’s secret formula. The models always get some before a shoot and us staff get some after a job well done. It’s almost treated like a currency around here. Supposedly, its lard sweetened with sugar and cinnamon, but that’s just poppycock, ain’t it?”

“Huh,” Maya replied, not really paying attention to Lotta. She felt a second wind coming on got hungry again, so she grabbed another burger.

“It’s like this one girl who quit a few weeks ago ‘cause she said all the food was cooked in lard and it was harmful to her health. Now isn’t that just silly? I know lard when I taste it and this chicken ain’t fried up in lard.” As if it would prove a point, Lotta helped herself to another whole greasy, fattening fried chicken.

“Really?” said Maya, still not fully paying attention. That stuff really was delicious. Maya chewed her burger, but glanced at the cupboard where the ‘formula’ was kept.

“I bet you’re really here because you’re looking into Shelly’s murder. Nicky boy got you working hard for him?”

Maya snapped back into reality. “Oh, Nick, that’s right.” She swallowed the last of her burger.

1112321122.content:
Maya’s eye kept straying over to the cupboard where the ‘formula’ stuff was sitting. Supposedly sweetened lard or not, the stuff was addictive…

“Ah, shoot!” Lotta had dropped a piece of chicken on her pullover. She wiped frantically at it with a napkin. “Don’t want a stain to set in. I’ll be right back.” Lotta ran to the bathroom.

Now that she was alone, Maya seized her chance. She bolted over to the cupboard were the formula was kept and set the jar up one the table. It held about a liter or two of the thick cream. Maya scooped it with her hand and let the deliciousness melt in her mouth like cotton candy. In a minute she had the contain empty and was licking the stuff off of her fingers.

…And then the buzz hit her again. At once she felt hungry again, her belly screaming for more food. Maya attacked the buffet table, and now what she ate could be tracked in the bulk scale. She devoured four trays of burgers, three baskets of fries, five pizzas, several different bowls of pasta, two trays of hot dogs, a tray of tacos, three plates of cookies, two chocolate cakes, a apple pie, a peach pie, and a cherry pie, a gallon of milk and a plate of buffalo wings. She at as if she was in a eating contest, her mouth chewing and swallowing at lightning speed as her hands shoveled the food into her mouth.

“I think I managed to get it out.” Lotta returned as Maya started on the fried chicken. “Geez, Maya, at least leave some chicken for the rest of us.” She grew worried as Maya finished the chicken and stuffed her face with a cheesecake. “Slow down, girl, there’s no need to eat that fast…” Lotta’s gaze fell on the empty basin. “Oh no, you didn’t eat all of the formula, did you. Good lord, I never saw anyone eat that much of it…”

Maya’s stomach was numb from the sheer amount of food that was being crammed into it. She didn’t slow down her frenzied eating, but her steps lagged as her body tried to move under such pressure. The edges of her vision got fuzzy, and as she swallowed her last doughnut Maya felt like she was falling into blackness.

Maya awoke in a bed in a dim room. She groaned and looked around. Lotta was sitting in a corner fiddling with her camera equipment. The photographer looked relieved when she saw Maya stir. “Man, girl, you were out of it for a good few hours. Your cell phone has been ringing for the past few minutes, but I couldn’t find it. Is Nicky boy trying to call you?”

“Nick!” Maya sat up and pulled her from her pocket. She pushed redial on her phone.

“Maya!” Phoenix exclaimed through the phone. “We’re just about to reconvene in court! I’ve been trying you the whole recess! Where have you been?”

“S-Sorry, my phone wasn’t getting reception,” she lied.

“Well, I need to know everything about the victim’s life that you’ve found out about.” Maya told him the little she had heard about Shelly’s workplace and how F. A. Feedem had been trying to meet the victim. She knew it wasn’t much, and she felt ashamed for not finding out any more information in the time she had to investigate. Surprisingly, Phoenix didn’t seem all that worried.

“You said she worked for HIPPO Magazine? Hmm… Edgeworth presented some evidence related to that magazine. I might be able to use this. Bring anything you can when you come to the courthouse. And one of those magazines would help!”

Maya groaned and groggily thought about what she should do. She could try some more rush interviews and get all the information she could before she left. Her hand strayed down to her belly. She peered at it in shock. Her much bigger, fatter belly poked out from her acolyte robes and sat in her lap. Oh dear…

111232112222211112.content:
As Maya approached the entrance to HIPPO Magazine, something caught her eye in the alleyway behind the building. An overturned bucket of fried chicken sat in the middle of the alley, with freshly gnawed bones spilling out of it. But Maya was more intrigued by what appeared to be a stack of photographs caught under the paper pail.

Maya tried to bend over to look at the pictures, but realized that this would be impossible given her new girth. Maybe if she tried to bend her legs, she could get on her knees and put her hands out here to steady herself…

PLOP! Maya’s attempts at leaning to look over her massive belly proved to be disastrous, as the shift in her center of gravity caused her to fall flat on her face! Well, not exactly flat on her face because her fall was nicely cushioned. Maya felt her flabby rolls jiggle from the shock of her impact. Luckily, her head managed to land right by stack of photos, so Maya picked them up to look at.

The first photo seemed to be taken from a window right above this very alleyway. Maya recognized the placement of a dumpster that was just a few feet to her left. A large girl was talking a cell phone. She looked a little familiar…

Maya snapped her fingers. The woman in the photo was Shelly Ulite, the victim of the case being tried in court today! Maya studied the photo intensely. Shelly was dressed in very fashionable clothes, which would be expected for a model to where. Shelly was wearing skintight designer jeans that accentuated her hips, and a tank top cut low enough to show off her generous cleavage yet also short enough to leave her luscious belly exposed.

Maya flipped to the next photo, which must have been taken a few moments later. Shelly was walking toward the street, but her path was cut off a mysterious man. He was wearing a tweed cap, sunglasses, and a scarf to disguise his face, and wore a heavy jacket. Although this photo only showed Shelly’s backside, Maya could tell that the fat model was startled.

The next photo made Maya gasp. Shelly and the mystery man seemed to be having some kind of an argument. Shelly’s posture suggested that she was yelling at the mystery man. The man’s expression was undeterminable from the objects that covered his face, but he held something shiny in his hand. It looked like a knife! But there was another person in this photo.

A man that was standing on the sidewalk outside the alleyway was peering around the corner of the next building, watching the argument take place. Maya peered in closer to look at the man’s face. It was F.A. Feedem, their client and supposed murderer of Shelly Ulite!

In the next photo Mr. Feedem was running towards the mystery man, arms outstretched and mouth open. The mystery man hadn’t noticed Mr. Feedem yet, as he was too busy raising the knife over his head to stab Shelly, who was backing away in fright.

The second to last photo scared Maya the most. Mr. Feedem must have finally gotten the mystery man’s attention, because the disguised stalker was poised in the middle of a punch to Mr. Feedem’s jaw. Shelly had turned around to run away. Her now visible face had a look of panic on it.

In the last photo Mr. Feedem was laying on the ground, apparently dazed. Shelly was no where to be seen. The mystery man had almost disappeared. Only his leg was visible in the corner of the photo as he ran to the street to escape. Although the photos showed a frightening scene, they were just the perfect piece of evidence to prove that some one besides F.A. Feedem had the desire to kill Shelly Ulite. But who would be taking photos of a scene like this?

Maya struggled to roll onto her side so she could look up the side of the HIPPO Magazine building. A clothesline dangled from an open window with a few photos clipped to it. A camera on a tripod was also sticking part way out of the window as well. It was probably Lotta’s room. The photographer had a knack for accidentally taking pictures of the crimes Phoenix and Maya investigated that would end up becoming important pieces of evidence. Lotta had done it again; it also explained the signature skewed angle of the attack taking place, a knack shared by many of Lotta’s photos.

Never mind that now. Maya had to get these photos to Phoenix as fast as she could. They only problem was, she was so heavy she couldn’t lift herself off the ground!

“Dang, Maya, how’d ya get down there?” a voice rang from above.

“Lotta!” Maya gasped. She quickly hid the photos under her tremendous bosom. “Ah, ha-ha-ha…It looks like I’ve fallen and I can’t get up.”

“Shoot, that’s apparent. Just hang on a sec’ and I’ll come down and get ya!”

It was Lotta who took these pictures. The girl must’ve have left a window open and her camera had fallen over just as the confrontation between Shelly and the mystery man had taken place and luckily took shoots of the scene below. Lotta had developed them since that time, but did she really know what her camera had taken pictures of? Nevertheless, Maya tucked the photos into a fold of her robes under a fold of her flab for safe keeping.

Lotta came out of a side door, followed by Cora. The two fatties helped Maya to her feet, which was a strenuous task for all three of them. Lotta and Cora had perspired a bit but Maya was very hot and sweating profusely.

“Lord sakes, girl, you’re sweatier than my uncle’s pigs! Why don’t you come inside where it’s cooler? Would you like a drink of water?”

“Yes please,” Maya panted. Lotta and Cora led her inside, where the AC cooled Maya off quickly. Lotta sat her on a plump couch and Cora fetched Maya a tall glass of water. Maya thanked her for it and guzzled it down in ten seconds. Maya leaned back, feeling much better although she still breathed heavily from the strain of getting to her feet.

Cora spoke up. “Oh Maya, your figure has greatly improved since the last time we met.”

“Y-yeah,” Maya giggled. She realized her boobs were almost completely exposed and covered them with her robe.
